name: Axe Beak
description: A large, flightless bird used as a mount in the far north.

name: Boar
description: An trained boar favored as a mount by dwarves.

name: Camel
description: A humped mammal favored by desert civilizations for their ability to withstand droughts.

name: Donkey
description: A relative of the horse often used as a pack animal.

name: Dragonnel
description: A distant relative of dragons raised from eggs to be used as mounts.

name: Elephant
description: A massive mammal with tusks used for war by some cultures.

name: Elk
description: An antlered mammal favored as mounts by some primitive cultures and druids.

name: Griffon
description: A cross between a lion and an eagle, and a difficult mount to tame.

name: Guard Drake
description: A small draconic creature that acts similar to a dog.

name: Horse, Draft
description: A large horse used as a pack animal.

name: Horse, Riding
description: A standard-issue riding horse.

name: Mastiff
description: A large dog used for hunting or war.

name: Moorbounder
description: A cross between a panther and a boar from marshy terrain.

name: Moose
description: A larger relative of the elk with scoop-shaped antlers.

name: Mule
description: A hybrid of a horse and a donkey used as a pack animal.

name: Pegasus
description: A winged horse that is notoriously difficult to tame. Almost all pegasi available for purchase were obtained unethically.

name: Pony
description: A smaller relative of the horse favored as a mount by halflings.

name: Rhinoceros
description: A large, horned mammal used by some nomadic cultures.

name: Warhorse
description: A horse bred and trained for war.

name: War Ox
description: An oversized ox bred and trained for war.
